titleStmt.title: Description of University of Pennsylvania Ms. Codex 925: De amore et dilectione dei et proximi, ac de forma vitae . . . etc.

notesStmt.note: Title from table of contents (f. iii recto); 17th-century title page lists titles of other works by Albertano (f. ii recto).

msIdentifier.repository: Kislak Center for Special Collections, Rare Books and Manuscripts

msContents.summary: Collection of works (with preceding table of contents) by Albertano da Brescia on civic peace, the community, and the role of the individual; also includes a letter by Bernard of Clairvaux, and a copy of the apocryphal letter of P. Lentulus to the Roman senate describing the physical appearance of Jesus Christ; manuscript has been completed in two parts (first part, f. i-ii, 1-48; sectiond part, f. 49-86, i-ii) which have been bound together.

msItem.title: De amore et dilectione dei et proximi, ac de forma vitae . . . etc.
List of contents, f. i recto
Liber de amore et dilectione dei, f. 1r
Liber de doctrina dicendi et tacendi, f. 77v

supportDesc.extent: 90 leaves : 231 x 137 (168 x 85) mm. bound to 238 x 140 mm

collation.p: Parchment, ii (17th-century paper) + 90 + ii (17th-century paper); 1² 2-7⁸ 8-11¹⁰; [ii], 1-86, [ii]; contemporary foliation in ink, upper right recto. Catchwords in pen-flourished boxes on the lower center of the last verso of quires 2-7; quires 8-11 have catchwords on the lower center verso of the last verso of each quire.

layoutDesc.layout: Written in 35 long lines; ruled in lead and drypoint; prickings visible; rulings in the second part (f. 49r to end) done with a rake.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Written in an Italian Gothic book hand by two scribes in red and brown ink.

decoDesc.decoNote: Illuminated 3-line initial "Q" with flowers, gold, and blue, red, green, pink, and yellow ink (f. 50r), pen-flourished 2-line initials in red and blue (f. 49r-84r).

binding.p: 17th-century vellum with gilt title Opere spiri. temp.

origin.p: Written in Italy (perhaps Veneto) in the early 15th century (Zacour-Hirsch).

history.provenance: Formerly owned by Michel Chasles (bookplate, inside upper cover: "Ex bibliotheca Michaelis Chasles Acad. Scientiar. Socii." with engraver's signature L. Benard).
